lead_paragraph: Citizens are increasingly deploying social media in nations where corruption and abuse by security forces sometimes occur with few repercussions.

byline.contributor: Sean Lyngaas contributed reporting from Abidjan, Ivory Coast; and Tony Iyare from Lagos, Nigeria.
byline.original: By DIONNE SEARCEY and JAIME YAYA BARRY

headline.print_headline: Africans Turn a Video Lens on the Police
headline.main: Inspired by the U.S., West Africans Wield Smartphones to Fight Police Abuse

snippet: Citizens are increasingly deploying social media in nations where corruption and abuse by security forces sometimes occur with few repercussions....
abstract: West Africans, inspired by videos that have depicted police killings and defined Black Lives Matter movement in United States, are increasingly using social media in countries where brutality by military security forces, open public bribery and other transgressions sometimes happen with little consequence; videos have not always produced tangible results like prosecutions, but have been greatly increasing public awareness.
